question: Read the passage below and choose the most appropriate transition word or phrase to fill in the blank.
text: In The Call of the Wild, Jack London portrays Buck’s transformation from a domesticated dog into a creature of the wild. Buck’s instincts sharpen as he learns to survive in the harsh Yukon wilderness, adapting to the brutal conditions around him. _____, his growing strength and independence symbolize his complete return to his natural state, free from human control.
explanation:
Correct choice A: Consequently
The correct answer, "Consequently," highlights the cause-and-effect relationship between Buck’s adaptation to the wilderness and his eventual transformation into a wild, independent creature. It underscores the progression of his journey toward freedom.
B) Similarly would incorrectly suggest a comparison, which does not align with the sentence’s focus on cause and effect.
C) In contrast would incorrectly imply an opposition, which does not fit the logical progression described.
D) Despite this would incorrectly imply a contradiction between Buck’s adaptation and his transformation, which does not match the intended meaning.
